WorkItem.Description: For now, many items do not have information on where they drop, so the best way for me to filter out heroic raid loot would be to disable ilvl 372+ gear. At the moment using the "Disable by Item Level" filters would also eliminate all 359 raid gear, since the available 359-378 range is too large. As a workaround until the item database can be completed, having 359-371 and 372-378 (or just change 379+ to 372+) options would be more useful. (I see that there are plans to implement manual entry of an ilevel range in the future; at least, that's what I expect the grayed out "Filters by Item Level" stub is going to be for. This request is to help cover the common "filter everything from heroic-difficulty raids out" case in the meantime.) More granular normal vs heroic dungeon ranges might be useful to some people as well.
WorkItem.Summary: [Feature Request.ItemFilters] Better "Disable by Item Level" Split

Comments.Message: Jorny, can you just implement a two-thumb slider for this? (aka a double slider)?

Don't forget, you can manually edit the filters to add that separation in yourself. The Edit button is at the top of the Filters Tree.

I'll take a crack at getting those other Filters sections fleshed out today.

Ha, sorry about that. I totally didn't notice that tiny, unobtrusive Edit button there! I'll make use of it. Thank you! Maybe make it a little more obvious for the blind users of your software? ;) Appreciate everything you guys do, it's amazing.

I edited the iLvl filters so that 359 gear was included with the heroic gear.   This way I can easily see the epic crafted and rep pieces that I need to acquire to be ready for raids.  All I really need filtered is the heroic raid stuff and sub-333 gear.  So with the one change it works nicely.

Disable by Item Level Filtering now supports Normal and Heroic Dungeons and Raids.
As for the Slider - That would be awesome. I would even settle for direct entry. But until then the new Disable by Item Level should hold you over.
This was updated both both MTRazeR and I for the new iLevel setup difference.
